entry.title: SAP SD Certification code
entry.content:
Dear Community,
I would like to schedule an exam for SAP SD, 
Could you please let me know the latest SAP SD global certification code for exam.

Thanks!!

entry.title: Query on Multilevel and Period Control Methods in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi, can anyone clarify where I can find the list of standard multilevel methods and period control methods available in SAP Public Cloud, apart from what's shown in the depreciation key details? Also, is it possible to change the percentage rates in a multilevel method in the Public Cloud?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: SAP JVA Partner billing issue
entry.content:
Hello Team,

This issue is related to SAP Joint venture accounting module partner billing issue.

When the business is running the GJ14 transaction for hardcopy billing, the amounts in partner billing is not adding up correctly and we could see difference between expenditure, working capitals and total payments total amounts.

I have seen the business has not maintained the JIB/ JIBE mapping configuration and we get warning messages of JIB/JIBE mapping failure message no GJ837 during execution of expenditure details before billing. So can this be the reason for the difference between the total amounts and expenditure/ working capitals in hardcopy billing?

entry.title: WebIDE time out
entry.content: We right-click on the Fiori project in the Full Stack Web IDE and select the Deploy option. Then, we proceed by choosing Deploy to SAPUI5 ABAP Repository. Next, we select the name of the connected system on BTP and continue. Finally, we choose the request on the system and start the deployment. However we got timeout error. We have increased the parameter HTML5.SocketReadTimeoutInSeconds. We have decreased the package size from 20MB to 4MB we didn"t get error. Is it related with the package size because it takes between 15-20 mins and it fails. Sometimes it is not failed and succesfully deployed.

entry.title: [Student Project] TypeError in Analytical List Page with OData V4
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm a student working on my end-of-study project and need your help with a Fiori issue. I'm developing an Analytical List Page using OData V4 service  with BTP Trial  and encountering a JavaScript error.

Context:
- App Type: Analytical List Page (ALP)
- Service: OData V4
- This is part of my final academic project

Problem:
I'm getting a TypeError: "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'map')" when the FilterBar building block is being processed. The error occurs in the library-preload.js file.

Error Details:
trace info in the image :

 

{
"initialProperties": {
"showMessages": false,
"variantBackreference": "fe::PageVariantManagement",
"enableFallback": false,
"showAdaptFiltersButton": true,
"p13nMode": "Item,Value",
"useSemanticDateRange": true,
"liveMode": false,
"suspendSelection": true,
"isDraftCollaborative": false,
"initialLayout": "compact",
"showClearButton": false,
"_applyIdToContent": true,
"disableDraftEditStateFilter": false,
"internalFilterChanged": ".handlers.onFiltersChanged",
"internalSearch": ".handlers.onSearch",
"afterClear": ".onAfterClear"
},
"resolvedProperties": {
"contextPath": {
"path": "/zc_eee/",
"value": {
"$kind": "EntityType",
"$Key": [
"id"
],
"id": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 60
},
"equipment": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 18
},
"division_loc": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 18
},
"secteur_exp": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 18
},
"categ_equip": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 18
},
"type_objet": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 18
},
"date_debut": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.Date"
},
"date_fin": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.Date"
},
"heures_marche": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.Decimal",
"$Nullable": false,
"$Precision": 15,
"$Scale": 3
},
"heures_pannes": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.Decimal",
"$Nullable": false,
"$Precision": 6,
"$Scale": 1





},
"heures_entretien": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.Decimal",
"$Nullable": false,
"$Precision": 6,
"$Scale": 1
},
"heures_repos": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.Decimal",
"$Nullable": false,
"$Precision": 15,
"$Scale": 3
},
"unit_of_measure": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 3
}
}
},
"isPublic": false
},
"missingContexts": {}
}

 

 

here is my cds from the abap : 

 

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewName: 'ZCEEE'
@AbapCatalog.compiler.compareFilter: true
@AbapCatalog.preserveKey: true
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'eeee'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define view zc_eee as select from ZC_EQUIPMENT_SELECTION as e 
{

  @ui.hidden: true                                  
  key e.id,

  @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 10 }]
  @ui.selectionField: [{ position: 10 }]           
  e.equipment,

  @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 20, label: 'Division localisation' }]
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [
    { entity: { name: 'ZC_EQUIPMENT_LOC', element: 'LocationDivision' } }
  ]
  e.division_loc,

  @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 30, label: 'Secteur' }]
  e.secteur_exp,

  @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 40, label: 'category ' }]
  e.categ_equip,

  e.type_objet,

  @ui.selectionField: [{ position: 20 }]          
  e.date_debut,

  @ui.selectionField: [{ position: 30 }]           
  e.date_fin,

  /* mesures agrégées */
  @DefaultAggregation: #SUM
  @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'unit_of_measure'
  @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 50 }]
  e.heures_marche,

  @DefaultAggregation: #SUM
  @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'unit_of_measure'
  @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 60 }]
  e.heures_pannes,

  @DefaultAggregation: #SUM
  @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'unit_of_measure'
  e.heures_entretien,

  @DefaultAggregation: #SUM
  @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'unit_of_measure'
  e.heures_repos,

  e.unite as unit_of_measure

}

 

 

this is the metadata.xml  generated by the  sap tools in vscode :

at PageController.ts:109:54
at m.runWithOwner (ManagedObject-dbg.js:1216:14)
at D.runAsOwner (Component-dbg.js:806:24)

 

What I've tried:
i tried to  take off the  filters from the CDS and regenerated new  app Fiori  but the  problem  persist ,  when  i try  to  make the preview form the Eclipse  , the  interface shows up  with no error !  

Question:
What could be causing this 'map' property to be undefined in the FilterBar context? Are there specific annotations or configurations I should check in my CDS view or service?

As a student, I would greatly appreciate any guidance or suggestions from the community!

entry.title: Passing custom parameters to MenuItem in SAP B1 Web Client add‑on
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m developing an addon for the SAP B1 Web Client and I’m running into an issue with a MenuButton: I’d like to pass custom parameters (e.g. a timestamp, values from another data source, etc.) to my onMenuItemPress handler, but I can’t figure out the correct way to do this via aggregations and bindings.

Below are the relevant snippets from my original code:

// overlay.json
{
  "controller": "satacon.demo.demoSata.controller.test",
  "events": {
    "dataLoad": { "procName": "onDataLoad" }
  },
  "overlay": {
    "before": [
      {
        "guid": "eYw7UEkk3Qynbr4DjuHNax",
        "items": [
          {
            "guid": "pfKjesz1qTQaNiHm3NL7xM",
            "ctrlType": "b1.sdk.CheckBox",
            "label": "Checkbox Selected",
            "selected": "{@@data1>/selected}"
          },
          {
            "guid": "bWiRc3dAXqnVaXWSodqH7B",
            "ctrlType": "b1.sdk.Input",
            "label": "Input Value",
            "value": "{@@data1>/value}"
          },
          {
            "guid": "CPBttPSfQTeAQnOnOTXiFg",
            "ctrlType": "b1.sdk.MenuButton",
            "text": "MM1 Suite",
            "icon": "sap-icon://customize",
            "buttonMode": "Split",
            "items": {
              "path": "@@data3>/menuItemData",
              "rowsData": "{@@demo>/values}",           // Is this wrong?
              "template": {
                "ctrlType": "b1.sdk.MenuItem",
                "key": "{@@data3>key}",
                "text": "{@@data3>text}",
                "icon": "sap-icon://edit",
                "keyz": "{@@data1>/key}",              // Is this wrong?
                "press": {
                  "procName": "onMenuItemPress",
                  "params": {
                    "key":       "{@@data1>/key}",
                    "text":      "{@@data3>text}",
                    "timestamp": "{= new Date().toISOString() }",
                    "customParam":"myCustomValue"
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
// Controller.js
define([ "./utility", "../model/models" ], function(utility, models) {
  class Controller {
    async onDataLoad(oEnv, oEvent) {
      // populate data1 and data3
      this.data1 = { selected: true, value: "hello", key: "CPBttPSfQTeAQnOnOTXiFg" };
      const oView = await oEnv.ActiveView();
      await oView.setCustomizedData(this.data1, "data1");

      const resp = await (await oEnv.getService()).ServiceLayer.get(
        "view.svc/flusso_nprsB1SLQuery?$filter=nprs_c_prg eq 'VE1200'&$select=nprs_c_srl,nprs_etichetta"
      );
      const rows = resp.getData().value.map(r => ({ key: r.nprs_c_srl, text: r.nprs_etichetta }));
      this.data3 = { menuItemData: rows };
      await oView.setCustomizedData(this.data3, "data3");
    }

    async onMenuItemPress(oEnv, oEvent) {
      const params = await oEvent.getParameter("params");
      // here I want to read params.key, params.text, params.timestamp, params.customParam
      await oEnv.showMessageBox("You selected:", JSON.stringify(params, null, 2));
    }
  }
  return Controller;
});

entry.title: Report to show Items in all Programs
entry.content: I need to inactivate a VID item. However, the item is in several programs. Does anyone know a way to find out which programs contain which items?

entry.title: Missing 'Public' checkbox in VariantManagement – UI5 app with P13n
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m currently building a SAPUI5 standalone application (on-premise, not running in Fiori Launchpad) and I’m using the P13n engine with a GridTable. I’m using the UI5 version 1.120.33.  

I’m following this example from the SAPUI5 documentation:

Personalization for grid table - Samples - Demo Kit - SAPUI5 SDK

The variant management control is using the class sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement

In that example, it's possible to save variants as public.
However, in my own app, the  "Public" checkbox and field are missing in the variant management popup – I only see the option "Set as Default".

In the backend I have also given myself the role SAP_UI_FLEX_KEY_USER. Flexibility is also enabled in the manifest.json like this: "sap.ui5": { "flexEnabled": true, "libs": {"sap.ui.fl": {}}}

What could be the reason that the option to publish a variant as public is missing in my application?

Many thanks in advance

entry.title: Implementing "Add Card to Insights" in a Fiori Elements List Report Application
entry.content:
I am trying to implement the Add Card to Insights feature in my Fiori Elements List Report application but have encountered issues. Below is an overview of my application and the problem:

  • Type: Fiori Elements App (based on sap.fe.core.fpm)
  • OData Version: V4 with List Report
  • Customization:
    • Explicitly declared Variant Management in the XML view since it wasn't supported via the manifest.
    • Extended with a Custom XML View + Controller.

I want to enable the Add Card to Insights functionality for my List Report table. I attempted to configure this using the following controlConfiguration in my manifest.json:

"controlConfiguration": {
  "@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem": {
    "tableSettings": {
      "type": "ResponsiveTable",
      "enableAddCardToInsights": true
    }
  }
}

 

However, this configuration did not work.

then

I manually called a POST request to the INSIGHTS_CARDS endpoint with dummy data for a card. The response indicated: "message": "Insights is inactive" with error code /UI2/INSIGHTS_MSG/008.

but
I'm getting XML response when i try to access this below metadata

/sap/opu/odata4/ui2/insights_srv/srvd/ui2/insights_cards_read_srv/0001/INSIGHTS_CARDS$metadata

entry.content:
Hey dear reader,

I have a FPM App with custom page with XML View and I would like to show the RAP Actions in a footer bar.
Something like a building block for actions.

I am able to show the buttons in the footer from a Fiori Elements Page or standard Object Page from the FPM with the same oData, but in my Custom Page I do not want to re-implement the whole parameter dialogs and call functions, rather then I would re-use this from the RAP framework.

Appreciate any help.

SAPUI5

entry.title: Enabaling/Disabling SAP Macros Table Action buttons with JS?
entry.content:
Hi all -wanted to know if its possible to control enabling/disabling a SAP Macros Table action on the front-end? I have a SAP UI5 application based on the Flexible Programming Model template. I have a task where when a user selects a table row, the action button should only enable when a specific table field is set to a certain value. 

Ex. When table field = 1 -> action1 button should be enabled. If table field is not 1, then action1 button is disabled. I know that the SAP macros XML attribute "enabled" can be set to false and true and I was hoping I can control that manually. 

I started the logic by grabbing the table controller "this.byId("table name") and can see the actions inside the object. I just was not sure if there were methods to retrieve the action objects? 

Update: I ended up solving this by creating a JSON model to bind to the "enable" property in the XML view of my macros action. I found a similar task here: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/enable-button-based-on-a-condition-sapui5/qaq-p/12606940

In my onInit() function I created a new JSON model -> set the action1 variable to false -> and then set the model "actionStatus"

onInit: function () {
PageController.prototype.onInit.apply(this, arguments); // needs to be called to properly initialize the page controller
const actionStatusModel = new sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel({
buttons: {
action1: false,
},
});
this.getView().setModel(actionStatusModel, "actionStatus");
},

In onAfterRendering function, I attach my function "buttonStatus" to the event handler "attachSelectionChange". This fires my buttonStatus function evertime I click on a table row in my list view. 

onAfterRendering: function () {
        const that = this;
        const oTable = that.byId("Table");
        if (oTable) {
          oTable.attachSelectionChange(this._buttonStatus.bind(this));
        }
      },

My buttonStatus function just grabs the table row data and checks for the value of the "status" field from the table. Depending on the value it will set the JSON model variable "action1" to true or leave it as false. We set the JSON model property. 

    _buttonStatus: async function (oEvent) {
        const oTable = this.byId("Table");
        const actionStatusModel = this.getView().getModel("actionStatus");

        const oSelectedData = await ActionHelper._getSelectedRowData(
          oTable
        );

        const statusField = oSelectedData.status;

        actionStatusModel.setProperty("/buttons", {
          action1: status === "0", //Enable if statusFIeld === 0, otherwise disable
        });
      },
 
Then in the XML view, we make sure that we bind the "enabled" property correctly. So now this will be set to either "true" or "false" depending on the outcome of buttonStatus function. 
<macros:Table class="table" id="Table" metaPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem" filterBar="FilterBar" selectionMode="Single" />
 <macros:actions>
   <macroTable:Action id="action1" key="action" text="Test" press=".onTest" placement="After" requiresSelection="true" enabled="{actionStatus>/buttons/action1}" />
 </macros:actions>
<macros:Table/><span><br /><br /><br /><div> <p><span>__PRESENT</span></p><p><span>__PRESENT</span></p><p><span>__PRESENT</span></p></div></span>

__PRESENT

entry.title: SAPUI5 Localization with i18n in annotations.xml not working
entry.content:
Hello,

I try to override annotations coming from backend OData service for SmartTable Headers with a local annotation.xml.

The local annotations file has been created using the Service Modeler.

I added some Annotations to the file, but it always states "Text key is not available. 'i18n.properties' file is missing or not registered in 'manifest.json' fileannotation-service(missing-i18n-key)". The problem is in line 39 of annotations.xml with the key "IsAssigned".

i18n is defined in manifest.json and the key I want to use is defined in i18n.properties.

I attached the manifest.json, the i18n.properties and the annotations.xml, maybe someone here has a solution for my problem.

Thank you!

entry.title: Pasar identificador unico de usuario desde app móvil a app SAPUI5 embebida
entry.content:
Hola a todos,
Quisiera pedirles ayuda a quienes hayan logrado algo similar y me puedan orientar.

Tengo un desarrollo web hecho con SAPUI5 , el cual ya está listo y embebido dentro de una aplicación móvil . El flujo es el siguiente:

  • El usuario accede primero a la aplicación móvil.

  • En ese ingreso, la aplicación móvil captura la cédula del usuario (como identificador único).

  • Luego, dentro de esa misma aplicación móvil, se carga la aplicación SAPUI5 embebida.

Lo que necesito es que, al momento de ingresar a la aplicación web, esta pueda recibir esa cédula enviada desde la aplicación móvil , para que el desarrollo haga automáticamente un filtro de datos y muestre la información correspondiente al usuario.

Agradezco mucho si alguien ha realizado este tipo de integración y puede compartirme cómo lo logró o qué debo tener en cuenta.

Saludos

entry.title: Fiori Elements: Display Tree-Structure using OData Annotation (Code Based)
entry.content:
Hello,

I want to create a Tree Table with Fiori Elements using SEGW, but I'm not able to do so.

I try to follow this posts:
Fiori Elements: Display Tree-Structure using OData... - SAP Community
Fiori Elements Tree Table with SAP Annotations - SAP Community

This is my data table:

This are the fields:

 

These are my CDS Views:

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

@EndUserText.label: 'Intermediate View for Tree Structure'

define view entity ZCDS_I_TREE_STRUCTURE

as select from ztree_table

{

key id,

parentid,

hierlevel,

drilldownstate,

nodename,

nodedescription

}

 

@EndUserText.label: 'Konsumptions-View für ZTREE_TABLE'

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

//@OData.publish: true

@UI.headerInfo: {

typeName: 'Knoten',

typeNamePlural: 'Knoten'

}

@Hierarchy.parentChild: [{

name: 'TreeHierarchy',

recurse: {

parent: ['parentid'],

child: ['id']

},

siblingsOrder: [{

by: 'nodename',

direction: #ASC

}],

rootNode: {

visibility: #ADD_ROOT_NODE_IF_DEFINED

},

orphanedNode: {

handling: #ROOT_NODES

}

}]

define view entity ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTURE

as select from ZCDS_I_TREE_STRUCTURE

{

 

key id,

parentid,

hierlevel,

drilldownstate,

@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 10, label: 'Node Name' }]

nodename,

@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 20, label: 'Node Description' }]

nodedescription

}

 

 

In SEGW I created a project and the did a right click on "Data Model"  then "Reference" / "Data Source" and chose my ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTURE. Icreated the runtime objects and redefined the method "define" in my *MPC_EXT class with the following code:


METHOD define.
  super->define( ).

  DATA: lr_entity    TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_entity_typ,
        lr_property  TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_property,
        lr_annotation TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotation.

  lr_entity = model->get_entity_type( iv_entity_name = 'ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTUREType' ).
  IF lr_entity IS BOUND.

    " 1. id als Knoten-ID
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'id' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_node_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 2. RELATKEY als Parent Node
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'parentid' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_parent_node_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 3. SeqNo als Hierarchieebene
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'hierlevel' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_level_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 4. drill_state als Drill-Down-Zustand
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'drilldownstate' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_drill_state_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

  ENDIF.
ENDMETHOD.

If I create then the Responsive Table in the BAS, it shows me my data correctly. When I change to type "TreeTable", it shows me "No data found".

What am I doing wrong?

Thanks and best regards
Thomas

@MR_srinivas 
@SumitKundu 
@jmalla

entry.title: CAP + SAPUI5 - How does auth work?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am currently developing an application with the following components:

- CAP backend,

- FE Frontend

- Several SAPUI5 (Freestyle) Frontends

Up until now I have only used auth: mocked or dummy. This way, the connections between front- and backend have worked seamlessly. Now, after having deployed my SAPUI5 frontends to the HTML5 repo and trying to do POST requests against the backend I get a 403 - forbidden response (works however in BAS dev env and Postman) - also the GET requests from the very same SAPUI5 Apps work. I have done some research on this and most articles were suggesting CORS / CSRF issues but I also read that this is handled automatically by the SAPUI5 Framework. Further research suggested that deployed apps require proper token based authentication, which is why I am trying to setup XSUAA now. However, I am having a hard time wrapping my head around this as to what is exactly required for my frontends, backend, managed approuter,..etc.. Thus, I am asking you for some guidance regarding these topics / my issue. 

Regards,

Oliver

entry.title: How to Use NPM Modules Like crypto-js in SAPUI5 Using UI5 Tooling Modules
entry.content:
Use NPM Modules in SAPUI5 on Cloud Foundry with UI5 Tooling (crypto-js Example)

Ever wanted to use modern JavaScript libraries like crypto-js in your SAPUI5 project? You're in the right place.

With the help of ui5-tooling-modules, you can now seamlessly integrate NPM modules into your UI5 apps—no hacks or copy-pasting needed.

Let’s unlock powerful encryption, hashing, and token generation in a few simple steps! 🚀

Note: This method is designed for use inside controller files (or any AMD-style module). You cannot use require() or top-level import syntax like in standard Node.js or modern frontend frameworks.

Prerequisites

  • Node.js installed

  • SAPUI5/Fiori Tools CLI
  • UI5 Tooling v3

    Step 1: Create a Basic SAPUI5 Project

    Use the SAP Fiori Tools or Yeoman generator.

    • Template: Basic

    • Data Source: None
    • Attributes: Default

      Ensure index.html looks something like this:

       <script
                   id="sap-ui-bootstrap"
                  src="resources/sap-ui-core.js"
                  data-sap-ui-theme="sap_horizon"
                  data-sap-ui-resourceroots='{ "your.project.namespace":               "./" }'
                  data-sap-ui-         oninit="module:sap/ui/core/ComponentSupport"

                 data-sap-ui-async="true" data-sap-ui- frameOptions="trusted" /> 

       

      Step 2: Install ui5-tooling-modules

      In your project root:


      npm install --save-dev ui5-tooling-modules

      ✅UI5  Tooling v3 handles module resolution—no need to add ui5.dependencies manually.

    • 🔒Step 3: Install crypto-js


      npm install --save-dev crypto-js

    • Step 4: Use crypto-js in Your Controller

      You can now use the npm module in any controller like this: 

       

      sap.ui.define([
      "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller",
      "crypto-js/sha256"
      ], function(Controller, SHA256) {
      "use strict";
      return Controller.extend("your.project.namespace.controller.Main", { onInit: function () {
      var message = "Hello UI5!";
      var hash = SHA256(message).toString();
      console.log("SHA256 Hash:", hash);
               }
          });
      });
      Reminder: This pattern only works inside controllers or AMD modules. You cannot use npm modules globally in your app or with require() outside of SAPUI5’s module system.

      Step 5: Configure ui5.yaml

      builder:
            customTasks:
                        - name: ui5-tooling-modules-task
                           afterTask: replaceVersion
      server:
             customMiddleware:
                 - name: ui5-tooling-modules-middleware                                             afterMiddleware: compression
                  - name: fiori-tools-proxy
                   afterMiddleware: ui5-tooling-modules-middleware

    • Step 6: Run and Test

      Start the app using:

      npm run start-noflp

      Open DevTools → Console. You should see the SHA256 hash logged.

       

      Why Use crypto-js in SAPUI5?

      • Modern encryption, hashing, and token generation

      • No external script tags or CDNs
      • Works natively with AMD modules in SAPUI5
      • TypeScript-friendly
      • Perfect for using NPM modules inside controllers

        Final Thoughts

        Thanks to ui5-tooling-modules, integrating npm packages like crypto-js is clean and stable. While it’s limited to controller (or AMD module) scope, that’s often enough for most enterprise UI logic.
        Whether you’re building internal tools or customer apps, this setup empowers you to use modern JS libraries safely within the SAPUI5 ecosystem.

entry.title: Adaptation Project for Post Outgoing Payment (F1612)
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I'm working on an adaptation project for the "Post Outgoing Payments" (F1612) Fiori app. The adaptation project works fine in Preview and in the Adaptation Editor, but after deployment, launching the app shows a blank page.

Here’s the error shown in the browser console:
Uncaught (in promise) Unknown consumer of clearing library: <my namespace>
I haven’t made any modifications—just created the adaptation project and deployed it as-is. I expected it to load like the default app, but instead, I’m getting this blank screen.

For context, I'm using VS Code and have tried both the @SAP-ux/generator-adp and @SAP/generator-adaptation-project to generate the project. The result is the same in both cases.

Has anyone experienced something similar? Is there a workaround or specific configuration required to enable adaptation for this app?

Thanks in advance for your help!
